alert.note: Alert for Big Island South; Kohala; Kona (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued January 21 at 3:38PM HST until January 23 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT THROUGH EARLY MONDAY MORNING FOR THE NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND FOR THE NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH EARLY MONDAY MORNING FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH EARLY MONDAY MORNING FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF LANAI... .An extra large northwest (300-320 degree) swell will rapidly build late tonight through Sunday and will produce extremely dangerous surf. Waves could overtop lower roadways especially during the early morning high tides along north and west facing shorelines. ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SUNDAY TO 6 AM HST MONDAY... * WHAT...Surf rising to 10 to 14 feet by Sunday evening. * WHERE...Kona, Kohala and Big Island South. * WHEN...From 6 AM Sunday to 6 AM HST Monday. * IMPACTS...High. Expect very strong breaking waves and powerful currents. Waves breaking in channel entrances may make navigating the channels dangerous.
info.instruction: Stay away from the shoreline along the affected coasts. Be prepared for road closures. Postpone entering or leaving channels affected by the high surf until the surf subsides.
